title: Ticket #4619: Shadow error causes job to be un-removed
description:
If a running job is removed, and then shadow exits with JOB_SHOULD_HOLD, the schedd puts the job in the HELD status without setting JobStatusOnRelease. Then, if the job is released, it goes to IDLE status instead of back to REMOVED.

SetAttribute() already has a check for JobStatus, to save the previous value as LastJobStatus. We can expand that code to ensure that JobStatusOnRelease is set appropriately when the status changed away from REMOVED, and that once the status has been REMOVED, it can only switch between HELD and REMOVED.

In Scheduler::jobExitCode(), if the shadow's exit status is JOB_SHOULD_HOLD and the job's current status is REMOVED, then the schedd should leave JobStatus as REMOVED and let the the job leave the queue. The same goes for DedicatedScheduler::reaper().
remarks:
2014-Sep-30 16:18:27 by jfrey:
We could enforce the rule that REMOVED jobs that are HELD can only go back to REMOVED using LastJobStatus, and get rid of JobStatusOnRelease.

2014-Oct-10 16:22:23 by gthain:
CODE REVIEW

While the changes here all look good, they call set_job_status, which commits the change in job status as a non-durable transaction. Isn't that a problem in a lot of cases?
